codeSystems.name: BinaryDataEncoding
codeSystems.title: CDABinaryDataEncoding
codeSystems.description: Identifies the representation of binary data in a text field

codeSystems.name: CDAActClass
codeSystems.title: CDAActClass
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the major type of Act that this Act-instance represents.

codeSystems.name: CDAActClassObservation
codeSystems.title: CDAActClassObservation
codeSystems.description: An act that is intended to result in new information about a subject. The main difference between Observations and other Acts is that Observations have a value attribute.

codeSystems.name: CDAActMood
codeSystems.title: CDAActMood
codeSystems.description: A code distinguishing whether an Act is conceived of as a factual statement or in some other manner as a command, possibility, goal, etc.

codeSystems.name: CDAActMoodIntent
codeSystems.title: CDAActMoodIntent
codeSystems.description: An intention or plan to perform a service.

codeSystems.name: CDAActRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: CDAActRelationshipType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every ActRelationship instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints to what kinds of Act objects can be related and in which way.

codeSystems.name: CDAActSubstanceAdministrationCode
codeSystems.title: CDAActSubstanceAdministrationCode
codeSystems.description: Describes the type of substance administration being performed.

codeSystems.name: CDACompressionAlgorithm
codeSystems.title: CDACompressionAlgorithm
codeSystems.description: Type of compression algorithm used - limited to 4 concepts from original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAContextControl
codeSystems.title: CDAContextControl
codeSystems.description: A code that specifies how an ActRelationship or Participation contributes to the context of an Act, and whether it may be propagated to descendent Acts whose association allows such propagation.

codeSystems.name: CDAEntityCode
codeSystems.title: CDAEntityCode
codeSystems.description: A value representing the specific kind of Entity the instance represents.

codeSystems.name: CDAEntityNamePartQualifier
codeSystems.title: CDAEntityNamePartQualifier
codeSystems.description: Qualifies parts of names

codeSystems.name: CDAEntityNameUse
codeSystems.title: CDAEntityNameUse
codeSystems.description: A set of codes advising a system or user which name in a set of names to select for a given purpose - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAInformationRecipientRole
codeSystems.title: CDAInformationRecipientRole
codeSystems.description: Used to represent the role(s) of those who should receive a copy of a document - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAMaterialEntityClassType
codeSystems.title: CDAMaterialEntityClassType
codeSystems.description: Types of Material for EntityClass “MAT”

codeSystems.name: CDANullFlavor
codeSystems.title: CDANullFlavor
codeSystems.description: CDA NullFlavors - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAObservationInterpretation
codeSystems.title: CDAObservationInterpretation
codeSystems.description: One or more codes providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation - limited to values available in original CDA

codeSystems.name: CDAParticipationType
codeSystems.title: CDAParticipationType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every Participation instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints on the Roles undertaking the participation. Limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAPostalAddressUse
codeSystems.title: CDAPostalAddressUse
codeSystems.description: A set of codes advising a system or user which address in a set of like addresses to select for a given purpose - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDARoleClass
codeSystems.title: CDARoleClass
codeSystems.description: Represent a Role which is an association or relationship between two entities - the entity that plays the role and the entity that scopes the role. Roles names are derived from the name of the playing entity in that role.

codeSystems.name: CDARoleClassAssociative
codeSystems.title: CDARoleClassAssociative
codeSystems.description: A general association between two entities that is neither partitive nor ontological.

codeSystems.name: CDARoleClassMutualRelationship
codeSystems.title: CDARoleClassMutualRelationship
codeSystems.description: A relationship that is based on mutual behavior of the two Entities as being related. The basis of such relationship may be agreements (e.g., spouses, contract parties) or they may be de facto behavior (e.g. friends) or may be an incidental involvement with each other (e.g. parties over a dispute, siblings, children).

codeSystems.name: CDARoleClassRoot
codeSystems.title: CDARoleClassRoot
codeSystems.description: Corresponds to the Role class

codeSystems.name: CDARoleCode
codeSystems.title: CDARoleCode
codeSystems.description: A set of codes further specifying the kind of Role; specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.

codeSystems.name: CDASetOperator
codeSystems.title: CDASetOperator
codeSystems.description: Determins the intersectionality of multiple sets

codeSystems.name: CDASignatureCode
codeSystems.title: CDASignatureCode
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying whether and how the participant has attested his participation through a signature - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition.

**Note:** CDA Release One represented either an intended (`X`) or actual (`S`) authenticator. CDA Release Two only represents an actual authenticator, so has deprecated the value of `X`.
